accuracy.name: accuracy
accuracy.explanation: Accuracy describes how well a model performed at classifying data.

balanced_accuracy.name: balanced_accuracy
balanced_accuracy.explanation: Balanced Accuracy describes how well a performed by taking the average recall across each class.

confusion_matrix.name: confusion_matrix
confusion_matrix.explanation: The Confusion Matrix summarizes performance and can highlight areas of weakness where incorrect classification is common.

f1.name: f1
f1.explanation: The F1 score is a weighted average between a models precision and recall scores

fp_rate.name: fp_rate
fp_rate.explanation: FP Rate describes what percentage of wrong predictions were false positives.

jaccard_score.name: jaccard_score
jaccard_score.explanation: Jaccard Score measures the similarity of two two sets of data, and returns a result from 0 to 100%.

precision_score.name: precision_score
precision_score.explanation: Precision Scores indicates a models ability to not label a positive sample as negative.

recall_score.name: recall_score
recall_score.explanation: Recall Scores indicates a models ability to classify all positive image samples

tp_rate.name: tp_rate
tp_rate.explanation: True Positive Rate is the probability that a positive example will be predicted to be positive.

mean.name: mean
mean.explanation: Mean is the expected value of data.

covariance.name: covariance
covariance.explanation: A Covariance Matrix shows the directional relationship between different data members.

num-Nan-rows.name: num-Nan-rows
num-Nan-rows.explanation: Num Nan Rows indicates the number of NaN rows found in the data.

percent-Nan-rows.name: percent-Nan-rows
percent-Nan-rows.explanation: Percent Nan Rows indicates the percentage of rows that are NaN in the data.
